com.googlecode.imheresi1.logiclayer.localization
Class Position

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.imheresi1.logiclayer.localization.Position

public class Position
extends java.lang.Object

Class that handles the Position type This type stores values for latitude and longitude to specify the location of a user GeoIP module is needed in order to use the constructor through IP.

Author:
Arthur de Souza Ribeiro, Jose Laerte, Raquel Rolim, Raissa Sarmento

Constructor Summary

          Sets the values of longitude and latitude stored in the position object.

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Position

public Position(java.lang.String ip)
         throws PositionException
Constructor for creating the Position object in an automatic way. Uses GeoIP to find the values of longitude and latitude through the given IP. Sets the values obtained in the object.

Parameters:
ip - IP to obtain the values of latitude and longitude from
Throws:
PositionException - if the values ate not valid or could not find the GeoIP database

Position

public Position(double latitude,
                double longitude)
         throws PositionException
Constructor for creating the Position object in a manual way. Manually setting the values of latitude and longitude

Parameters:
latitude - new latitude to store
longitude - new longitude to store
Throws:
PositionException - if either one of the values passed are not valid.
Method Detail

setPosition

public void setPosition(double lat,
                        double lon)
                 throws PositionException
Sets the values of longitude and latitude stored in the position object.

Parameters:
lat - new latitude to store
lon - new longitude to store
Throws:
PositionException - if either one of the values passed are not valid.

getLatitude

public double getLatitude()
This method returns the current Latitude stored in the Position object.

Returns:
string representing the latitude

getLongitude

public double getLongitude()
This method returns the current Longitude stored in the Position object.

Returns:
string representing the longitude

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Method to format the data (Latitude and Longitude) stored in the Position object for better visualization and understandment of the values.

string representing the formatted data
